description:
My husband and I have been missing a neighborhood Italian dinner spot to go to since we moved to SF from NYC.  This place fills that gap for us! We typically eat at the bar, split an app, and each order a main pasta.  The food is nice and cozy, and I really like their simple, straightforward pasta dishes. 

My husband also discovered the glass of Montepulciano they offer on the menu is great to pair with.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Not sure how this place is a 3.5 currently???


Solid, solid, solid!  We've been going here for over 20 years.  The staff, the boneless chicken and the casual environment are highlights of many.  Highly recommend.
author: Leo S.

description:
TL,DR: awesome gratis bruschetta, perfect kids meals, delish food and awesome wine list. 

We were at a concert across the way at the Calvary Presbyterian Church Sunday afternoon. We stepped into the JFT at 5:45 and they were willing to sit us at a table provided we vacate before 7. Not a problem since my kid was starving and we are fast eaters. 

As we waited for our food, each person was served a bruschetta on their own plate. It's free and delicious. So good that my lil monster ate most of mine. 

Knowing that my lil monster was hungry, they were so awesome to bring out his plate of food within minutes!! It was so delicious and perfectly done that the lil one had this super happy smile and making his happy food noises!

Then my plate of Penne Pescatore arrived and I was in my own kind of heaven. All the seafood was perfectly cooked and the sauce was so good, I was scooping it up with a spoon!!

The wine recommended was perfectly paired. Totally will be coming back!!!!
author: Steffy W.

description:
Amazing customer service ,food was great , custom made to order, male staff was great 
Definitely have to try the desert 

Try to book reservation online, but quick turn around
author: Tara M.

description: Fair prices for good pasta. It can get a bit crowded since it's a smaller space so be sure to call ahead to be put on the waiting list.
author: Kevin R.

description:
Jackson Fillmore is another stalwarth Italian restaurant that has been around forever.  I moved to SF in 1994 :O and this place was already there.  

It is a neighborhood restaurant, right on the corner of Fillmore and Jackson - thus the name :D brilliant huh?  Fillmore is a busy street with lots of stores so parking is hellish, so if you live in the hood you're better off walking over from where you live.

Ambiance is cozy and friendly, service is good, and the wine list has a good choices.

The food is good, for American Italian. Jackson Fillmore is not an authentic Italian restaurant, and that is OK, but be warned: because of the American Italian nature of it, they tend to overdo it.  Case in point, in Italy pasta with pesto is typically a very simple dish. If you are lucky and have access to original trofie from Genoa, you add pesto, and you're done. The pesto is already so full of flavor that you really don't need anything else. Distracted by the company's conversation, I ordered the Ravioli al Pesto Genovese.  I did notice that it was ravioli, so I knew that the ricotta cheese filling was going to interfere, but they add green beans, potatoes and fresh tomatoes?? I mean it was OK, but that is the typical overdoing it I was talking about.

Any place with Fra Diavolo anything is not authentic.

Anyway, not bad, I have come here a few times over the years, mostly because some friend really wants to go, but there is better in SF.  My 2 cents.
author: Massimo M.

description:
A cute neighborhood spot with great pasta!

I really enjoy dining at Jackson Fillmore Trattoria. Yes, it is small but it's got a really nice quaint, neighborhood-y vibe. The staff is friendly enough and the service is usually pretty quick. The food is DELICIOUS. I'm a big fan of their pastas - the Spaghetti alla Carbonara is particularly tasty. 8/10.
author: Katie C.

description:
So I've now been here a dozen times and it's time for a review. I think I have a pretty good sense of the place. 

JF belongs in the 4.3 range, but given the options I'm given, it deserves a 5 in this particular rating. Why? Well, context is important: this is your neighborhood trattoria. It's probably not where you're going to get engaged, but it is consistent and excellent for a regular or semi-regular night out that is going to fill you up with great food/wine and won't disappoint.

a) Service - helpful, friendly, and just all around very good and decent people. Never had an issue, and they are more than accommodating with kids (even very young ones).

b) Food - this isn't tasting menu type stuff (and that's not a knock), it's  homestyle neighborhood Italian comfort food and knocks it out of the park on that front. Don't miss the zucchini carpaccio. I generally stick with pastas, and on that front the carbonara is deeply satisfying. Don't forget to try the warm and/or cold zabaglione (I them making it a hot fire stove on the way to the bathroom and it was impossible not to order), it's something I haven't seen on many other menus and is delicious.

c) Wine List - extensive and and you can find some great options at reasonable prices.

Downsides? Nothing really negative, just get your expectations in line - it's a neighborhood trattoria, excellent, often rich home-style food and great drink. It (99% sure) used to be a sushi bar and not a ton of $$$ has been spent making it feel particularly Italian or upscale...so if that's a negative for you, so be it. It's not an issue for me!
author: W N.

description:
Tortellini! 
Spaghetti ala Carbonara!!
Gnocchi!!!

Just three of the best dishes I've had anywhere! Great service. Incredible food. I love this place! My wife and I had one of our first dates here and consider this the best Italian in the city. We take all our friends and family visiting from out of town and everyone agrees!  Do yourself a favor and go to Jackson Fillmore!
author: Michael B.

description: Such good Italian food. Cute little hole in the wall with great service. I had the red snapper in spicy tomato sauce, super tasty. Tiramisu is also delicious.
author: Lillian W.

description: Business dinner, fairly large party, pretty small place. Shoved us all into a small little area, fairly cramped. BYOB. Service left a lot to be desired, server had the air of an aloof burn out. The gentleman I was with was dropping a fairly good knot and barely got the time of day from the place. I was not impressed. Folks said the food seemed good. I tried the mushroom app and ordered the fish special, not a pasta guy. Was my fish plate worth under 30? Not really. Would I go back? Too many other options to warrant a revisit of a place that could not be bothered.
author: michael w.

description:
Overall, enjoyed a fun Saturday night here dining with friends.

Service: 5 stars - Everyone was really friendly and helpful accomodating the seven of us with our two bottles of wine. The owner also made a fabulous wine and food recommendations. 

Food: 4 stars - Everyone at our table enjoyed different dishes and really enjoyed them. The special of the evening was a duck chorizo risotto. I had a bite and it was delicious. I ordered the pasta carbonara. Carbonara is my favorite and I was a bit disappointed that it was quite bland. I'm not sure if its because of the way the pancetta was cooked but there was no salty peppery taste that I love. The great ending to this food story was Mama's cheescake also on special. It is hands-down the best cheesecake I've ever had. If you like yours especially whipped, light and not too sugary this is the cheesecake for you.

Price/Ambiance/Space: 4 stars. Restaurant is everything I would expect for a neighborhood SF restaurant - smaller in size with market prices. 

Definitely coming back.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Went here on Saturday night about 830pm. We were easily seated. The place is quite small on the inside and the tables and on top of each other. Be prepared to be friendly. 

Appetizer: Prosciutto & melon.. Excellent

Entree: salmon. Awesome

Dessert: can't remember the name but it was chocolate with some sort of raspberry sauce. Very rich and tasty

The waiter are great and really friendly!!
author: Ayana K.

description:
Really disappointed with my dinner experience here after being recommended to it by some close friends. The service was rushed and curt, the food was extremely underwhelming and overall our dinner for 4 was just unremarkable.

To start, the bruschetta, while complimentary, was as uninspired and tasteless as it could get - a sign of the tastes to come.

Between the table we shared a number of items including the calamari, seasonal salad and baked artichoke. The calamari was the usual fried fare, the salad was swimming in oil (although the assortment of vegetables including the asparagus and peas were fresh and crisp) and the baked artichoke was bland and oily, too.

For our entrees I got the seafood stew and the rest of the family ordered a couple of the ravioli dishes and the gnocchi. The tomato-based components for dishes were lacking seasoning and would have been better off coming from a gourmet bottle of sauce from the store. The quantity of seafood was appropriate but none of it tasted fresh.

Located in a city with fantastic Italian restaurants, Jackson Fillmore Trattoria does itself no favors across its service and food. Between the rushed, ambivalent service and quickly prepared, flavorless food, I sadly have no intention of returning nor recommending it to anyone else.
author: Aaron B.

description:
Got seated right away and the hostess was great. Ordered a bottle a wine right away. When the server came to take our order after 5 minutes, we said we weren't in a hurry because we were old friends catching up. 2 minutes later, the server came back again. Same thing. After ten minutes, the owner/expediter? Came over to inform us that this "wasn't a sitting around kind of place" and that "we weren't the last table that would be sitting here that night". 

So, obviously we felt awkward and rushed. It ruined the entire experience. From there, we ordered immediately and our food came our quick. We would have stayed for more wine and desserts, but after the ridiculous comments and overall snotty service we got out of there as quick as we could. We decided to spend our time and money at a more fun and accommodating location down the street. 

Shame on you, Jackson Fillmore, for getting the food right but alienating patrons with you nasty attitude.
author: Ann T.

description:
Was so excited to try this San Francisco favorite! Per the recommendations we started with the zucchini appetizer and it kept its reputation as a tastebud pleaser! The bruschetta starter they gave also satisfied with a perfect sweetness of the tomatoes and savory saltiness of the garlic and olive oil. So simple yet super yum!!

I was trying for less carbs so tried the salmon with avocado and arugula. It was a generous portion and a good dish, but it didn't blow me away. I kindve wished I tried a pasta dish. 

We ended with a simple affogato which was perfect to share. 

Only 4 stars bc of the salmon being a bit dry and the bathroom a bit dingy. For the food and service I'd come back again!!
author: Amelia A.

description:
First thing we got there early on purpose to get a seat. Hostess first comment you need to leave by 7pm. Umm welcome to you too! That's fine, we will be done. My friend really wanted to try this place for some reason. 

We started with off the menu, burrata with fungi, that was delicious. Then I got spaghetti and pancetta, the noodles cooked perfectly the sauce a bit bland without the extra Parmesan I had to pour over. My friend got the pasta with  broccolini and shrimp. The vegetables are fresh, but that's about all I could say that was good about that dish. Imagine plain noodles tossed with those ingredients. Again bland! We had to pour a rim of cheese for some flavor. 

Service by our waiter was good. 
Will I go back? Probably not.
author: Karen T.

description:
I have been coming to Jackson Fillmore for 10+ years and had always enjoyed it. The waiters are nice, the food, usually delicious. But last night, 2 people cancelled due to illness so our party size went down to 2 and when I told the greeter lady, she gave me some real attitude and said I should've told her about the reservation change, and that now they can't seat us at a table. She made us sit at the counter, but I noticed two other couples showed up later and she took our table and separated it so they could each sit at a table. I've been a loyal customer for so long and this is the treatment I get at what used to be one of my favorite restaurants. I'm sorry she was having a bad day but aren't we all??

The food isn't that great either anymore...such a shame.
author: Nil U.

description: My favorite place in SF for Italian food. Everything from the wines to the pasta to the service. My family has been coming here for over 20+ years and we absolutely love this place. The food is traditional Italian food, served family style which I love. It is a neighborhood spot with no frills or fancy accents, this place is all about the food & wine!!! I love the Misto with chicken and sausage something that I get every time and is a must!
author: Dana C.

description: Been going here since living in SF 15 years ago, always great food and service, off the tourist path, can be quiet and relaxed or packed and fun. Not pretentious, but not phoning it in either.
author: Tim S.

description: My boyfriend and I love this place and often go here for a casual date night. The atmosphere is not fussy and the food is delicious. The wait staff is so friendly and welcoming and always describes the food with such passion. The buffalo di mozzarella is insanely fresh and yummy and I always love their specials. Prices are reasonable and portions are generous.
author: Hadley B.

description:
This review requires a list:

1.  Filthy bathroom, no seat covers, dirty floor and dangerous entrance to bathroom.
2. Dried out salmon entree
3.  No bread offered; it was stale, cold and hard when we finally got it.
4.  Forgotten drink order
author: Carolyn M.

description: Probably one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city. Great menu. Great service. Great location. Get in here and get the gnocchi! It's ridiculous.
author: Miles J.

description: I have been to Jackson Fillmore before and really enjoyed it.  Although tonight, I sat at the counter and the waitress (Kelly was her name - I thing) was so rude.  She looked bothered by the entire interaction.  Just rude!
author: N H.

description:
I would recommend to either have a reservation or arrive right when they open if you do not have a reservation because this small restaurant fills up quickly! We enjoyed sitting at the bar, on a Saturday night as we did not make a reservation but was still nice and you can see into their kitchen from there.
The service was quick, the wine was good and the food was even better. You begin with a complimentary bruschetta and although it was not on the menu they were able to make us two burrata bites, which I had heard about and they did not disappoint! Then we each ordered a different entree and I was so full by the time dessert came! We did not feel rushed but the staff was attentive and efficient, they prefer guests refrain from using their cell phones as stated on the menu which I thought was a plus.
I would come back here again and recommend the burrata bites!
author: Jen L.

description: I truly want to support local establishments, but my last 2 experiences here cause me to write this place off my list. The food is good, but the wine is way overpriced.  I was alone on my last visit so sat at the bar.  It took about 10 minutes or more to get someone's attention just to order a glass of wine.  After 10 more minutes of waiting for the wine, I gave up and got up to leave. The scruffy guy behind the bar was all smiles saying he'd already put my order in, but didn't seem to recall the wine. No apologies, no effort to make things right, I will never return. First timers good luck.
author: Stuart C.

description: This is a great a hole in the wall that has been around forever and manages to stay consistent after all these years. It's nothing fancy and the food tends to be a little too garlicky, but you always know what you're getting and it's always delicious. It has a great New York vibe and while the menu is very finite if you're looking for this particular type of cuisine, it really delivers. Their Fra di'Avola tomato sauce is spicy and zesty and really good. Their salads are great too.  This menu is not for the faint of heart and if you're on a diet this is not the place for you. But it is really worth a visit.
author: JT B.

description:
Jackson Fillmore is a great neighborhood restaurant. One of the best things about this place is that no matter how long it's been since the last time my husband and I have been there, everyone who works there knows us and acts like we are regulars. 

The food is consistently excellent. The waiters always have great suggestions, and they will make any changes to the menu that you want as long as they think it's a good idea. 

We usually get the pollo alla noci and ask them to put it over pasta, but tonight ordered one of the specials and it was great. 

 We love to bring our families here when they come from out of town!
author: Brooke S.

description:
Carb loading for him meant carb loading for me, sweet!  There's this weird rumor that people should avoid carbs.  That it's bad and unhealthy but I welcome it.  I survive on it.  I love it.

This hidden gem was packed on a Friday night but luckily we had reservations.

Zucchini Carpaccio- In writing, it sounded tasty. Visually, it was overwhelming and boring.  Taste wise, it was delicious.  I'm not sure how it was made but it had a nice roasted taste and the shaved parm with the almonds balanced out the dish.  Very light and enjoyable.

Spaghetti Carbonara- Per his request, this dish was a must.  It did not disappoint.  Very rich.  It could've used more panchetta..then again we probably didn't mix it well enough.  There was a pile of panchetta at the bottom of the plate at which he decides to scoop it up with a spoon and airplane it in my mouth...yeah, that happened.

Bombolotti- Pasta, meat, sauce.  That simple but that good.  Mix the mascarpone cheese well and take it from good to amazing.  

Slightly intoxicated, we had dessert elsewhere.  Overall, great meal, great service.
author: Linda N.

description:
I can't believe I've never dined here before. It's been a Pac Heights favorite for years. It's a tiny restaurant, so the place fills up quickly (and gets loud). If you're looking for an intimate romantic date spot, you probably dine elsewhere.

So why is the place so popular? Simple: the food is damn good. They're not going to win any James Beard awards or anything like that. But everything on the menu is delicious. It's like Italian comfort food.

I ordered the Orecchiette d'Elefante (breaded chicken cutlets served over mixed greens, 
topped with red onions, gorgonzola, and marinated cherry tomatoes). Not exactly diet food, but it was certainly tasty food. My dining companions all ordered pasta dishes. The one that looked sinfully good/carb-a-licious was the Tortellini al Forno (meat filled tortellini with mushrooms, prosciutto & cream, and topped with mozzarella & parmesan cheeses). I also heard rave reviews about the Linguini Vongole (linguini with clams and garlic in a white wine sauce). For an appetizer, we split an order of Bruschetta (it was fine, although nothing memorable), and my seafood-loving friends indulged in the Fried Calamari with garlic aioli.

Even though the place was packed, the service was on-point. There was never a long wait for our food or wine. Jackson Fillmore is definitely a smooth running machine. I now understand why it's been such a neighborhood staple for so long. I'd definitely recommend this spot if you were looking to get your mangia mangia on.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I have not been here in about 8 years, I used to live a few blocks away, and if I had a hankering I just called them (Jack usually answered the phone) and had them put me on the list so I didn't have to wait in the usual line.

Fast forward to last night and my man had never been.  Off we went, we called ahead and the same trick worked. (Jack was not there, too bad - he is a cutie).

I ordered what was my old favorite, the zucchini carpaccio - I have tried to recreate this at home to no avail. I'm not sure if it is super healthy - but man is it good. Then the Tortellini al forno, so good, and the best zabaglione I have ever eaten for dessert - in fact have never seen it served warm anywhere else - even in Italy.

Love love, the only downside is that glasses of wine are a bit steep ($9-ish)

for 1 appetizer, 3 glasses of chianti, 2 pastas and a dessert is was about $90 with tip
author: Amy W.

description: We have been going to this place for many years but we never experienced the rude behavior by the staff via the waiter (who also made it clear it was his restaurant) who served us earlier tonight. Two people of our 4-party table were 20 min late though we were drinking wine and beer while waiting. Once they showed up, the server, who identified himself later as the owner, was extremely rude and told us that the appetizers we wanted weren't available anymore (it was 8 pm, so not exactly closing time). Then he kept complaining that the main dishes we ordered would take 30-40 minutes to prepare and that we would get in trouble for not turning the table faster (go figure if he is the owner indeed). After some back-and-forth, he agreed to take our order. No one was waiting for our table by 9 pm, or after. The place wasn't full at all. We did not leave a tip but left a note about the abysmal service, mentioning that we would never come back. Then we left for our Lyft ride, waiting outside. Well, the guy accosted us on the street, saying that it was his restaurant and that half of our party was late, so it was our fault. I told him that it is inappropriate to treat people the way he did - regardless whether it's in a restaurant or anywhere else - and he seemed to calm down somewhat. Stay away from this place at any cost!
author: Todor G.

description:
This has become one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city! The free bruschetta at the beginning of the meal is so delicious. I wish they gave you more than one piece. Some of my favorite dishes are the gnocchi (which they rotate with different sauces and toppings) and the penne pasta with spicy sausage. For dessert, I would highly recommend the zabaione, which is an Italian custard. I am not usually a fan of custard, but this was so unreal (and it makes for an envious Instagram picture). 

The service is friendly and it really feels like a family-owned restaurant. The only downside is that the restaurant is so small and the demand is so high, I have gotten pushed out as soon as I paid my bill...
author: Heidi Q.

description: We ordered the special for $24 and got 4 medium sized raviolis with sauce. Hardly worth $6 each. I was disappointed with the entree.
author: Sherri W.

description: Rude. Disrespectful.  The haughty and unworthy management treat guests with utter merciless disdain.  I've tried many times here.  SF - please raise their rent and remove this establishment off of the face of the streets of SF.
author: Betsy V.

description:
A complete miss on everything - service, food, ambiance and price. I remember coming here many years ago and loving this place - definitely not the same.

We were 6 minutes late for a reservation for party of 6 on Friday evening - given other recent yelp reviews about needing to be prompt, I called half hour before our reservation to say might be few minutes late (due to rainy weather in Bay Area) and was told no problem- upon arriving we were chastised by the host for being late - and we were only 6mins late! Noise was extremely loud (do not expect to have a conversation unless yelling at one another). And food...waiter had no idea what was vegetarian and told our one vegan friend he couldn't have anything; I'm all for maintaining originality (and I eat meat), but this is San Francisco! Waiters should know the menu and easily be able to identify veggie options and should have at least one pasta can do as vegan. Lastly, this place is expensive! Highly recommend going somewhere like A16 or SPQR instead - pay not that much more and far superior food and service.
author: Lacy B.

description: Excellent service and Italian food! The restaurant is very small, but the food is delicious! The salad, bruschetta and the chicken dish with walnuts were amazing. The meals can be very rich with cream sauces, but excellent tasting! We will eat here again when visiting San Francisco. Our waiter was excellent! Friendly and attentive.
author: Teresa F.

description:
2.5 stars.  Booked a reservation only to be told when we arrived that they don't accept reservations for 2 people so we had to wait for an opening.  The wait was over 20 mins after the reservation time & we ended up seated at the bar which isn't easy to have a conversation because of the noise behind the bar & seated side by side.

The complimentary bruschetta was still amazing & wish I could have 2.  

$13 Burrata and golden beets was good.  A simple dish with good ingredients.  

$16.25 Bombolotti Sugo de Carne: Large pasta tubes w a tomato sauce of veal & spicy sausage, mushrooms & mascarpone cheese - sounds delish doesn't it??  It wasn't.  The only flavor was spicy red pepper from the sausage - overpowering.  Had to request extra mascarpone cheese to tone down the heat.  Complete disappointment.
author: Kim S.

description:
I've been here quite a few times.  It's a decent spot but hard to get excited about.  The bruschetta to start is nice. I like the bombolotti and the linguini prawns fra diavolo.  My wife likes the tortellini.  End up getting the calamari often as well although not special.

I don't understand why they carry the pesce fra diavolo, it's a joke.  Literally just a mediocre  piece of fish in a pool of sauce.  I love tiramisu in general, but can't get it here, it's just not good.

Finally I also don't get the service here.  It has been great a couple times, mostly not so much.
author: T B.

description: We dined at Jackson Fillmore on a recommendation of a friend and we weren't sorry. First of all, this restaurant begins with a "free" appetizer. Each diner receives a piece of plated bruschetta which boasts flavorful tomatoes and quality olive oil. I ordered a flavorful tortellini dish which was on the daily special board. It was delicious and tasted as if the pasta was homemade. The service was also great and the warm, casual environment was inviting and comfortable. I would definitely go back on our next trip. Also, the place was packed which is always a good sign, and that was at 8:00 on a week-night! Make reservations!
author: Marianne E.

description:
Called in on a late Sunday afternoon to put our name down for bar seats and got there and didn't have to wait, around 7 pm! 
The restaurant itself is tiny and quaint, and smells like a tiny old school Italian restaurant, it's almost confusing why the logo is so modern! 
We got the Multepulciano wine and they come out with complimentary bruscetta which was so great
I had the snapper fra diavolo which was fantastic- great portion and very tasty 
Friend had the carbonara which was great 
They did rush us out a bit at the end which was a bit rude
And the bathrooms are very skeevy- when you walk to the back you're basically in the trash alleyway and that sketched me out and is debatably a health concern- justifying only 4 stars here. 
Would definitely go back though!
author: Diana A.

description: Great dinner as expected.  I frequent Fillmore Tratoria in Portland and wanted to compare.  My dinner was outstanding. Thank you.  I had the special appy plus the artichoke.  Followed by the amazing redfish.  Oh it was all soo delicious. Thanks.  I'll tell Jack you guys continue to excel. Cheers !!!
author: Kevin K.

description:
The service is phenomenal and the food is even better. Start you meal with the carpaccio di zuchinne, quite possibly one of the tastiest appetizers you'll ever have. Pay attention to the specials for some outstanding fare, but you can't go wrong with Chicken Parmesan, spaghetti carbonara or the tortellini al forno! 

The wine selection here is quite impressive, and the staff knowledge of wine is very helpful if you need some guidance. 

Enjoy!
author: Darren S.

description: First off, this place is AMAZING. Small and true to excellent food. Robin and Casey are legit amazing. If they recommend, follow what they say!! Everyone gets amazing bruschetta as you sit down. And it's excellent. Then everything that follows is beyond. MUST TRY
author: Kelly L.

description: Delicious, melt-in-your-mouth Italian comfort food. Affordable and such pleasant service. So happy this spot is within walking distance of my home!
author: Brooks W.

description:
My go to.

Love this place! Food is excellent.  Wine selection is tasty.  Service is friendly.  Only challenge is the size of the place.  If you don't have a reservation, be prepared to be turned away.  There's an occasional seat at the bar, but there may be a wait.  But it's worth it.  Trust me.
author: Kelly W.

description: In a word - balls.  Sub-par service.  They completely screwed up the order...one of the veals was completely under cooked and another over cooked.  And veal was completely lacking in flavor.  They couldn't even clean the table between the main course and dessert...not acceptable.
author: Klaus M.

description:
Been going here for years and the same formula still works. Usually come here as a party of two, and get the bruschetta, maybe some small appetizer to share with my gal, a small salad, a pasta dish and dessert with espresso.  

Appropriate comment- Gal and I have always commented that the staff are pretty good looking!
author: Erik H.

description:
First, the rating system on Yelp is not accurate.  Three stars is not A-OK, which means very good, but OK.  And that's what I'm rating J-F, just OK.   I've been coming here off and on for over twenty years, but I've fallen off because of the palpable-if-I-act-cynical and unfriendly-maybe-I'll-get-a-big-tip attitude, which is worse than when Jack owned it.  

The food is quite good.  It's crowded, noisy, and uncomfortable.  There seems to be a lot of unbendable rules.  One gets a sense that the staff are not there to make their customers happy, but to get through the night.  One of the owners, a woman, is particularly grim and rigid.

I hardly go there anymore.
author: harmonia b.

description: What I love about Jackson Fillmore is their consistency, the food is always warm, the company is always cheerful and you always leave satisfied. There's not a lot of pomp and circumstance but for me, this is what makes a local regular spot. That said, I recently attended one of their wine makers dinners and they took it up a notch. I've been allergic to both Gluten and Dairy for 8 years now, and usually with Italian that limits my selection to 1-3 items, so when I called to see if they could accommodate me for their prefix menu I was shocked when they said "no problem." Anyone who has been accommodated at a restaurant usually doesn't have high expectations, as your meal is an afterthought and made of what's left to use. For me this has been the case regardless of menu pricing. Not with Jackson Fillmore. Not only did they create a menu specifically for me, each course fit into the same theme as all other dishes. I left not only full and happy, but also touched that they went out of their way to ensure my experience was just as delightful as guests without accommodations, and having been able to fully experience their culinary vision for the night. I loved Jackson Fillmore  before, but now I'm a lifer.
author: Matthew P.

description: A great little neighborhood Italian place. This was our first time at Jackson Fillmore and we had an early reservation and grabbed a seat at the bar for dinner. Right away greeted with a super friendly bartender, he knew his wine and had great recommendations on the menu. Very welcoming. The space is very comfortable, nothing overly designed and décor probably needs a slight refresh, but it still feels "neighborhoody" and local and casual. The food was excellent. We had the eggplant parm and meat ravioli along with the fried calamari, which tasted a little too smoked for me, but was still good. All in all, a great little place and we will absolutely make it more of a regular destination.
author: Michael C.

description: Fantastic 7:15pm dinner tonight at Jackson Fillmore Trattoria for the seven of us. Kelly wasn't working, but Robert handled the table like a champ. We told him we had show tickets for 9pm, and everything arrived timely. It was obvious that he had our schedule in mind. Great service, great food. And, at one point, I heard my friend next to me taste the food...and moan. Yes, it was that good....
author: D. W.

description:
I really wanted to love this place since it's right in my 'hood.  Food is great - especially some of their vegetarian dishes.  The zucchini salad is to die for (and i don't even like salads!).

The reason for the 3 stars is that they were out of several dishes when we went on Sunday night. My first choice Salmon was out and so were the calamari we wanted for appetizers. 

I'll definitely be back again. Hoping they'll have their signature dishes available!
author: Alice Z.

description: We had a 5:30 reservation through Open Table. Had a hard time finding parking, so I jumped out. Our seats were at the bar/counter. The hostess (why do restaurants leave this to a 20 something idiot?), said they have several large parties coming in and that was the best they could do. No apologies. I walked out. Best decision.
author: Debra C.

description: Used to love this place back when Jack ran it.  Have been going here for dinner for nearly 9 years.  Tonight took our two kids and everything from food to service was a mess and we were the first seating.  When I flagged over the owner to let him know his response was why are you telling me, I am not your server.  To which I clarified if he was the owner to make sure I hadn't mistaken him for someone else.  And he acknowledged that he was, the conversation went downhill from there.  We miss you Jack!  Jackson Fillmore is just not the same without you and sadly that was probably our last meal there.  Sad to see a neighborhood gem go.  I wouldn't waste a dinner or a night out on this place anymore.
author: Jessica C.

description: Best meal I've had in 2017. I don't need to say much more than that. Service was amazing. Very friendly staff. I wish I didn't live 3,000 miles away, because the food was unbelievable. Everything about this place is excellent.
author: John Paul S.

description: Fantastic! I highly recommend the zucchini appetizer and calamari. Both were absolutely delicious with great flavor. I had the gnocchi which I thought was really tasty however the only thing that was a slight let down was the size of the gnocchi istself and the portion size. For 20 bucks I'd expect a more filling plate but the texture, taste and sauce was on point. Love this spot and had a great time here.
author: Derek S.

description: We love this place.  If you're looking for a neighborhood Italian joint, this is the best in San Francisco.  Great menu, fresh and high quality ingredients, lots of flexibility to make stuff off the menu and just...really good food.  And love the complimentary bruschetta they serve.  The other side of the coin here is the service, which is equally impeccable.  Very friendly and they get to know the regulars.  Always feels like home going there.  The place is always packed, but we usually don't have to wait very long if we don't have a reservation.
author: Kevin G.

description: A place unlike other italian restaurants. Great neighborhood spot - a spot where they will know your name after just a few visits. A no-fuss place where you can get good food and have fun with friends in a bustling space. SF needs more mainstays like Jackson-Fillmore serving as anchors for the ever-changing neighborhoods!
author: Neal P.

description: This is one of the best italians restuarants I've been too! I really love their pasta with the Marinara and also their appetizer wityh the bread grain with the tomato fruit on top of it! Although the noise level is a bit high, it still is a great value place to go to if you're really into some hard core Italian for dinnertime. I also have other reviews for 2 other italian restarants in the same city named Giorgios and Gaspares so you can check those out if you want ot compare. They have pizza in addition to the other great stuff at this place there as they are pizzarias, not trattorias. This is a really great place for any of you guys out there and it's realy good quality!
author: Asher D.

description:
Absolutely love this place. I noticed some of the comments below that talked about the long wait time, etc. Yes, expect to wait.. like most places with great food, fantastic service and not a huge space.. .HOWEVER, the food is great and like I said, the service is awesome. This place has been around for over 27 years and I love that it has kept its authenticity. I have been coming here since I was little and it is always my boyfriend and my go to date night spot. 

Of course they are going to give their regulars a little special attention... after all, they're regulars have kept them in business when most restaurant fold within the first 3-5 years! But they are great about getting people in as quickly as they can and offering a drink while you are waiting. I also love that its a casual, comfortable, homey vibe. A lot of places in SF and become super trendy and fancy and I love that.. but its also nice to just throw on some comfortable jeans and have a nice, easy, delicious home cooked meal... of course with fabulous wine too :)

LOVE Jackson Fillmore and highly recommend.. i mean, they give you bruschetta instead of regular bread at the table... just with that i'm sold :)
author: Erin G.

description:
The zucchini salad is to die for. Gotta try it, simply put. 

All of their pasta dishes have been extremely satisfying as well. They are always served hot, and you can taste the freshness of the pasta and sauces. 

My favorite is the oven-baked ravioli. Super rich, but very rewarding, and it really fills you up, even though it looks like a small dish
author: Brandon C.

description: We come here every time we visit San Fran...if not several times a visit, and it is always amazing. Family neighborhood feeling with very friendly owners who make us feel like family. The food is terrific. We would recommend everything but almost every time we get specials so it's hard to recommend a specific dish. Just ask whomever is your server. They are great at pointing you to the perfect dish with a good matching wine. We love it and will always whole heartedly point everyone here
author: Kirsten S.

description: This is one of my favorite Italian places. Locals favorite.
author: Christi W.

description: Best Italian Spot in SF. I could eat one of everything on the menu. Solid wine list, Italian inspired. Would highly recommend for groups of 4 or less. 6 gets a little cramped and it's a small, intimate venue.
author: Danny F.

description:
Just back from the third visit to Trattoria. 

I had a salcicce special.

I waited but not too long. Lots o happy people around

Then it came it was beautiful to behold but nuclear in temperature,   I mean I burnt not only my tongue but a splatter hit my hand and it hurt.  I tried stirring cutting up the salecicce,  no relief

So I guess it sat and sat on the warming dock undelivered just getting nuked

Got a doggy bag figuring it would evetually cool, no apologies during payment

Maybe I'll go back,   but probably not...
author: Lou G.

description:
I finally tried by this neighborhood spot after it being on my radar for some time. I called ahead to secure two seats at the bar on a bustling Friday night. The small, but very efficient, restaurant is unassuming from the outside. The atmosphere inside is intimate but loud, service is attentive, and the menu and specials offer more than enough options. 

the food:
A simple little bruschetta to start off the meal, graciously passed around to diners for gratis as they settle in. The fig, burrata, arugula, & almond special was just plain good. The MVP of the night was definitely the Carpaccio di Zucchini {Julienned zucchini with toasted almonds & pecorino} - a definite must-try! Another dish that must be ordered is their gnocchi! It is prepared in-house, and melts in your mouth. The Gnocchi Gamberi comes with prawns and shrimp in a light tomato sauce, that will fill you up and satisfy the soul. Sitting at the bar, I watched multiple desserts get their final touches and go out to diners, and if I had enough room in my belly, I would have wanted to try every single one! Everything looked light but rich, and the perfect end to the meal. I hate coffee and I even wanted to taste the affogato!

Two thumbs up to this dining experience. I will definitely be back! A great place for a warm meal on a cold SF night, or a fun and lively place to catch up with friends over wine and pasta. A Pacific Heights gem, for sure.
author: Kaylan S.

description: Cozy, friendly, very unpretentious. A great neighborhood joint. Zucchini salad is a must!
author: Heather K.

description:
Party of three. Calimari fritti, ravioli of the day, chicken parmesan, chicken with walnuts, bruscetta. Everything well-made and presented, but the most SALTY food I have ever tasted. Think salty, and then double that. And add some more salt. Everything but the calimari was a salt bomb. And I'm no stranger to salt.

Did I mention it was a wee bit salty? Pretty much killed the dining experience for us.

Exceedingly pricey, and there was something about salt I was meaning to say...
author: Michael S.

description: Ok after 5 years of coming here. We still love our local. Kelly, Casey & the team are amazing. Always making you feel welcome. The food & wine selection are perfect.
author: Kelly T.

description: Always bring the fam here when they're in town. My mom won't visit unless and Jackson Fillmore night is happening. Best service and great vibes in this little spot. Vegan friendly to boot.
author: Emily F.

description: Their Spicy Spaghetti sauce is very well executed.  It is thick and full body and there is just enough sauce to dip the bread in.  I also loved their artichoke and mushroom salad.  The mushroom was seared with a hint of balsamic.  This restaurant is small, and if you have a large party you have to wait (reservation or not) but they did such a great job seating us despite our large party.  I keep coming back anytime I am in the city.
author: Shalizeh D.

description: This is one of our go-to restaurants and they consistently deliver great Italian for a good price. Definitely take a shot with any of the specials, but our usual ends up being pasta. I haven't had a bad plate here to date. Also, they always have a really nice and affordable selection of Italian wines and can give great recommendations if you aren't familiar. The entire staff is always friendly and even though it gets busy later in the week you can usually squeeze in without a reservation if you don't mind waiting a half hour or so. Stop by, we'll probably be at the counter drinking a glass of Nebbiolo.
author: Brian H.

description: What a great little hole in the wall! I almost didn't see it. A traditional SIMPLE Italian restaurant. And they mean simple! Bunch of guys in mixed match tees chatting with the kitchen as if the guest weren't even there. Loved it. Kinda like going to your brothers for dinner (and his buddies). Laid back atmosphere.  Great great great food. Italian classic ingredients but not too heavy. Even the other diners were super laid back and enjoying themselves. I'm new to the area and will definitely be back for this one. Great job guys.
author: Bryce B.

description:
This is our favorite Italian place in the city! They always have the best specials and their carbonara is UNREAL. The staff is extremely friendly and the environment is super cozy. 

If you are looking for a delicious Italian meal, Jackson Fillmore is your spot!
author: Kendall B.

description: Nice casual atmosphere.  Decent service.  Food is well-prepared and tasty.  But I deducted stars because the portions are pretty stingy for the prices and I left hungry.
author: Tom N.

description:
I have been here several times now, I try to eat here every time I am in San Francisco. 

Jackson's is a tiny little restaurant with a neighborhood feel. The decor is nothing fancy, in fact you may not even pay Jacksons much mind were you to walk by, but if you do happen by Jacksons, be sure to stop in for a bite!

Every time I've been there the servers have been very friendly and incredibly helpful. On my last visit my friend ordered one of the specials, not realizing it contained meat. When it came she explained to the server that she is a vegetarian and our server was quick to get her a replacement meal. He was so apologetic for not going over the specials in more detail. 

With your meal they bring a complimentary piece of bruschetta and I always wish there was more, it's delicious!

They always have some great specials, you might want to get there early though because they often run out of their specials of the day.

Some of my favorites off their everyday menu are:
Carciofi Ripieni 
Insalata Verdure
Gnocchi Gratinati
Ravioli Al Pesto Genovese
author: Michele B.

description:
The à la cart meals my girlfriend and I ordered were pretty good. They have an exotic wine collection which is where I am disappointed as a consumer. The quality of the wine was great, however the menu does not have prices and we were not apprised we were ordering $150 bottle from Maranello when we were simply dropping into a local joint down the street to grab some spaghetti. I'm not afraid to spend a little to try something new but give me a subtle hint that my wine is 4x our combined food bill. 

Food was OK. Just go to North Beach Cafe..
author: Danny O.

description: Love the heavy wine pours, but man, they have some weird appetizers. There were filet mignon pieces on kettle chips with bleu cheese dressing and brie with honey and espresso shavings? The wine wasn't too strong, but it came in large gulps, so that made things a bit more palatable, but the only thing I'd recommend would be the bruschetta. Wine selection is decent, and service is strong. Storefront is unassuming, so you might pass it by. Otherwise, it's a small little place that you might enjoy on a weekday night if you don't want to wait, but otherwise, it's pricey, and the food isn't so great.
author: Danny C.

description:
Pretty decent Italian restaurant.. cannot hold its own against some of the other awesome italian options in the city, but a pretty good bet if you happen to be in this neighborhood.
I had the 'Ravioli Al Pesto Genovese' (ravioli in pesto sauce!), and found it to be pretty good. Portion size was a little small, but quality was pretty good. Before that, we ordered the 'Carpaccio Di Zucchini' as appetizer, which I did not really like that much.
They were a lot of random 90's hits in the background which was pretty random.. Quirky is good!
author: Aditya M.

description:
I was a little surprised to come onto Yelp and see that the reviews were so low for Jackson Fillmore.  I think that it is possible that people are ordering some items that are not so good, so I'm here to give you a guide to enjoying Jackson Fillmore for the delicious restaurant that it is:

You have to, and I mean HAVE to order the Tortellini al Forno if you have never been here.  It is so delicious.  The flavors and textures are amazing.  It tastes so authentic.  

For dessert, get the zabaglione.  It sounds kinda weird.. but it is delicious.  I'm usually not one to order desserts at restaurants, but this one is totally worth it. 

I think that Jackson Fillmore maybe isn't the best choice for a casual night out, but if you are looking for a cute date location or for a fun night out to treat yourself, this place is just for you.
author: Alyx F.

description: I ate here on 12/2. Great food and service. We really enjoyed the wine recommendations from the server. I can't wait to go back.
author: Robert L.

description: Excellent service, food and drink. The Bruschetta and Zucchini Carpaccio were outstanding! For entrees the Gnocchi in a white sauce and the Ravioli Pest were outstanding. The desserts were to die for our group shared four and each taste was better than the last.  the Chocolate Fudge Torte with Zabaglione was mine but we didn't have a single fork or spoonful of food that wasn't outstanding. One challenge- seating is limited so imho, reservations are a must and I was surprised that they only opened at 5:30 pm on a Sunday.
author: Steve M.

description: This place seems to have it all: a cute, unpretentious location, a loyal following/reservations always full, and decent reviews. Don't be fooled. Totally unimpressed with the food and especially the service. It's almost like this place was caught in a time warp but didn't save the good stuff. They saved the explosion of chopped parsley on everything and the spiderweb creme anglaise. The zabaione, which I love and you never see on menus anymore, comes in a glass looking like a small child threw up after eating a carton of Big Stick popsicles. The complimentary bruschetta was welcome surprise and their red sauce is tasty--it just isn't enough. Not my bag, but they must be doing something right.
author: James S.

description: Great service.  Even better food!  One of my favorites :)  Cannot go wrong here!
author: Lauren W.

description:
The food and atmosphere here are fantastic.  This has been the closest restaurant to my apt for years, but the perpetual wait kept me walking down Fillmore.  I regret this.

The two of us were adventurous, so we instructed the waiter to order everything.  We had their famous bruschetta, a savory zucchini appetizer, chicken and red snapper meat dishes, and some fantastic ice cream ball creation covered in chocolate sitting in caramel for dessert.  The appetizer and dessert were the highlights.

Also, for a small busy place, the timing was perfect and we never felt rushed.  The food came out at just the right time, with a pause between courses to enjoy the wine.
author: Chris V.

description: Absolutely amazing. My boyfriend introduced me to this place. The bruschetta was the best I have ever had, clean fresh ingredients and just delicious. I had their gnocchi which was also the best I ever had.! The light creamy tomato sauce was perfect for the soft pillowy gnocchi. I would definitely recommend this hidden gem.
author: Melody P.

description: Great little spot in the area for a nice dinner. The burrata salad was delicious! We came late on a sunday night and could easily get a table.
author: natalie b.

description: Really great local place. Amazing burrata, daily specials, good pasta, and good Italian wine list.
author: Karolina Z.

description: Their carbonara is amazing, so creamy and rich. They give you bruschetta, which is so garlicky and delicious. Best Italian food I've ever had, You must try this place!
author: E B.

description:
have been a regular at Jackson Fillmore since their opening nearly 30 years ago and at the end of the day, when you're looking for a truly great, authentic trattoria one is hard pressed to find anything better in this town or any other around the world. Every appetizer and entree is delicious and ultimately satiating. Portions are generous and served piping hot. 

They DO get very busy and sometimes the staff has issues keeping that cup of coffee refilled but otherwise service quite good. I always recommend this place.
author: Bob F.

description:
If you don't like this place, don't come. Save the rest of us a spot who appreciate the art of great Italian dining. 

Fine wine, complimentary bruschetta, and the best portobello of your life make Jackson Fillmore one of the top notch neighborhood restaurants in town.
author: Mark C.

description: You don't really go here for the food - it's Just above-average. You go because the people are decent and the party next to are garrulous, in a good way.  That's what a trattoria should be! The bruschetta is a tart welcome. The chianti glow is a warm goodbye
author: Dana B.

description:
Great food. Local neighborhood trattoria.
I had the seafood with red sauce ands had them add some spice. NICE
Moderate prices.
Nice friendly service
author: bernard b.

description: One of my favorite SF restaurants. Linguine GOA is fantastic. Good scene, atmosphere, vibe and wine list. Highly recommend!!
author: Brian M.

description:
Place seems like a diner in New York. That's a good thing. 

Food is delicious -- We had the bruschetta, calamari, roasted artichoke, tortellini al forno, tiramisu, and the chocolate gelato. Service was fast and friendly, the staff genuinely seemed to enjoy working there.
author: Taylor S.

description: Great no-frills Italian spot for a quiet night out.  I've been here about 5 times and it never disappoints. Not too pricey either.  My favorite dishes are the Tortellini al Forno and the Orecchiette d'Elefante.  Only open for dinner Wed-Sun.
author: Louis D.

description: Jack from Jackson and Fillmore is one of the rudest people I have ever met and I will never recommend this place to anyone. There are too many places to choose from in the Pac Heights area to enjoy for dinner; I won't be giving him my money.
author: Niki S.

description: Visited this restaurant last weekend. A little too small and cramped to enjoy your meal. Tables are extremely close to each other. Was very surprised that they do not offer gluten free pasta. Waiter recommended the Red Snapper but it literally was a bowl of red sauce with two pieces of snapper floating in it. No side? Waiter friendly but they do rush you. With all the options available I would skip. We were visiting for the weekend. Fun neighborhood to walk around.
author: Catherine G.

description:
Hate to this as I have loved the place for years, but after tonight's meal, I left feeling very disappointed. In the past I have always been greeted quickly but despite the place almost empty it took almost 15 minutes for anyone to even say hello.

We got sat at bar (which I actually like) and our appetizers were good but our entrees were just terrible. All of us had pasta dishes, each were under seasoned and not cooked with the care and love I know this place for. Each one of the sauces were either watery(rather then creamy) or overly oily. Portion sizes for the price was very meager. Every thing (even the apps) was very one note. The pasta tasted frozen and not homemade. The staff seemed very off. Wait staff was polite but clearly something was going on. The kitchen staff looked like the were laughing about something about the wait staff and NOT paying attention to what they were cooking. It almost seemed like the kitchen was a drunk. 

The place had the feel of one of those restaurants on those restaurant rescue shows. At one time was great but now the staff and owner just don't care anymore. So sad the food used to be SOO good. 

Think I will give 6 months before I go back. Maybe they can get it together.
author: Brian M.

description:
Heavy wine pours which is amazing! 

I ordered the antipasto misto (on special) and the spicy sausage and chicken dish.... So good!  Great split for two! 

I'm an out of towner and would tell anyone to go there!! Reminded me of Florence, Italy!

Salute!
author: Jessica E.

description:
we were subletting an apartment here for the past 6 months - sort of a little hideaway in the city, a crash pad for after a late night on the town, and a staging location for pre-giants game preparations.

So on several occasions we popped over to Jackson Fillmore for dinner, usually 2 of us, once 3 and once a party 4.  We always sat at the bar except when we had the party of 4.  A couple times we showed up and got a seat right away, the other two times we called, spoke to the owner, and he had a spot waiting for us.

What I like about J.F.:
- Every time the food was very good, 
- the specials are particularly special
- the cooking is flavorful and light
- the wine selections are tasty and not outrageously priced
- the staff friendly, especially when sitting at the bar/counter
- conveniently located (for us anyway)
- away from the core Fillmore area so you don't get the "drunker" crowd that you get near Harrys Bar and the Boom Boom Room.
- nice mix of clientele.

Issues with J.F.:
- when crowded, service is not the best at the tables
- you can feel a little squeezed in there
- if you drive here, parking can be tough

so take advantage of the improving weather, walk down to the corner of Jackson and Fillmore and get some dinner at Jackson Fillmore.

yes, the name could be a little more original.
author: Jeff H.

description:
In a nutshell, the staff is generous with their time and insights, the food quality and price are very good by SF standards, and the interior has a cozy cafe feel. It's an ideal place for a great dinner that won't break the bank with a small group of people who are in a good mood. Interact with the staff, tell them what you like/dislike in food and wine, and you'll find they're responsive, flexible and eager to please.

As for the naysayers complaining about parking, comfort of sitting at the bar, or the less-than-Michelin star quality food simply don't understand SF dining.
author: Corey B.

description:
This place was recommended to me by a friend MONTHS ago. As I recently moved, the Jackson Fillmore Trattoria is now within walking distance from my place- so a girlfriend and I decided to check it out.

I've been told, on multiple occasions now, that this place is either a "hate" or "love." I don't really see it that way. There are things about this place that certainly are wonderful- and things that fell short.

Bueno:

JFT feels like a neighborhood joint. It doesn't have the pompous, pretentious feeling- despite being located in Pac Heights. It feels welcoming and comfortable. 

I love that we were sat right next to the open kitchen. I like when a place has nothing to hide.

The waitstaff were incredibly friendly and the host was cute. :)

No Bueno:

NOT impressed by the food. Bland, boring. I ordered the Carbonara and went through a half pound of pepper to try to liven it up.

Don't think I'll be back....
author: Annalise F.

description:
So this review is two fold. 

If you are looking for OKAY Italian food, come here. But only if you are okay with paying $18 for a pasta dish. This place would be the shitty Italian place in Italy. So it's the "good" Italian place in America. 

Basically, if you don't have high Italian standards, and think all pasta is the same, you will love this place. 

If you have higher standards, expect an exceptional pesto for $18, don't come here. Seriously, don't. 

If you want to pay $18 for pasta, don't expect any decor or service. They put a pitcher of water on the table and the place looks like a fancy diner.
author: Melissa G.

description: One of the best Italian place in SF! You feel at home, the food is great, service excellent!
author: Laurence F.

description: Have been here a few times and every time I am impressed. The food is fantastic and the service is top notch.  I would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Kegan A.

description:
I walked into a busy restaurant around 6pm and as a single was offered a seat at the bar (which I normally prefer) or a table, and chose the latter. My experience is that a single in a busy section is easy to overlook, but the service was impeccable. The drink order was taken and delivered quickly, and the rest of the meal was paced at a good tempo.  Service was attentive when required and inconspicuous otherwise. I ordered the pasta fagioli soup with fresh shaved parmesan and it was delicious. Even better, it was served absolutely piping hot - an all too infrequent treat when ordering soup in restaurant these days. My entree was a fresh homemade linguine with sausage and tomatoes, and it was excellent - the best pasta dish I've had in a long time. And again, served steaming hot fresh from the kitchen. Just excellent service.

I found the ambience of the room warm and cozy, suitably dim lighting and just the right amount of buzz in a busy room. Thx to all my fellow Yelpers for the accurate reviews that led me to this place - I'll definitely return any time I'm in the is neighborhood again.
author: Joe H.

description:
I have been wanting to try out Jackson Fillmore for quite some time. I have heard so much about it, and imagined an adorable, cozy, romantic neighborhood spot. I was pretty disappointed when I walked in the door. But let's start with the good..

*The food was good. Solid, tasty Italian fare. A diverse, but manageable menu. Decent pricing. Fantastic seasonal specials. I was not "wowed", but I did enjoy my meal.
*The service was great. Everyone was friendly, attentive, helpful, and polite.
*The food came out quickly. We had our salad on the table within 5 minutes of being seated.

Now for the bad..
*The decor was awful. I felt like I was in a cheap sushi restaurant that was converted into an italian restaurant. There was a bar with big pop-up plastic food holders (like in a sushi restaurant), the floor was unattractive and out of place, the bar chairs were filthy from mid-leg down to the floor, there were holes in the bar (where people probably kicked it while sitting at the bar), there were tons of wine boxes piled up above the bar, and I had a direct line of sight into the kitchen, which is NOT one of these modern kitchens that were meant to be watched.. it was not pleasant to see. There was absolutely no charm in here. It could have been an old diner with white table linens thrown onto the tables. Very disappointing and distracting.

So overall, decent food, very good service, awful decor/ambiance. Seems like this might have been a better spot in years gone by, but needs some TLC to restore it to its former glory.
author: Sherri H.

description: We brought a group of 9 to Jackson Fillmore - including 2 kids and an infant. We came early, they sat us in a cozy table and brought out some delicious Bruschetta gratis. The food was great, the wine was well provisioned and constantly refilled, and the server was very accommodating of our requests for more wine, fewer plates on the table, more napkins, etc. It was a great night and very special for our family.
author: Eric H.

description: Used to come here when I lived around the corner. Menu hasn't changed much, which makes me happy! Got the snapper diavolo which is one of my favourites! Great service and fun tiny atmosphere!
author: Kai P.

description:
This is such a great location and the atmosphere is nice but the food, what a shame.
I wanted to order just a half size of  spaghetti but was told it only came in one size. OK, save the rest for later. When it came it was steaming  HOT! This makes me think they make it early, freeze it and MICRO WAVE  a portion when needed. 
Also , no Pizza?! Too bad.
author: anne c.

description:
I'm giving this place 5 stars because it is the best little hole in the wall Italian I've had in a very long time. 

Starter: bruschetta comes out to your table instead of a basket of bread. It was Amazing!!

Appetizers: cow girl creamery triple cream Brie with prosciutto. Fried calamari both were excellent. The calamari and a delicious aioli 

Main course: Meat Tortellini with mushroom prosciutto and cream sauce. This was sooooo good I can't even begin to tell you. It came in a small shallow dish and the tortellini was baked with Parmesan cheese forming a warm crust on top. 

Honestly the only downside was how small the place is but we had a nice corner table so we still shared an intimate dinner.
author: Chelsea W.

description: I hesitate to write this review only because it will lengthen my wait for a seat at the counter. Food is always fresh, with some interesting season additions, staff is very friendly and takes care of the regulars. A terrific non pretentious spot in the neighborhood.
author: Andrew L.

description: The host at our bed-and-breakfast recommended this neighborhood place that's only a couple blocks away from where we are staying. We didn't have reservations but they worked really hard to get us in between the people who had reserved. We decided to eat at the counter. We ended up at the far end near the kitchen.now some people wouldn't like this. But we loved it. Could watch all the action and notice how the staff worked as a great team. Our waiter was fabulous, funny, and most attentive. In fact since we were by the kitchen several of the staff spoke to us and said nice things. And sometimes funny things. In very tight quarters we watched these people serve meal after meal while being kind and polite way with one another. Very professional. I had the artichoke and a chicken dish whose name I can't remember but it had walnuts and pinenuts and mushrooms and a cream sauce and it was to die for. So was the artichoke with seasoned breadcrbs, parmesean, and spicy red pepper flakes. My husband had a special which was a shellfish pasta and he also ordered the calamari appetizer. Dessert was a piece of melt in your mouth chocolate cake on top of cream with raspberry drizzle. Pure heaven. Reasonable prices, obviously a neighborhood favorite. We're so glad our host recommended this place, and we already put our name on the list at the end of the week. Such a great find where both the service and the food is top drawer.
author: Marcia K.

description: Lovely little Italian spot right in the neighborhood. Reliable for good food, good wine and a buzzing atmosphere. Definitely recommend it to anyone that's never been. A great date spot!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Classic neighborhood trattoria.  People who run it are very high quality folks... As good as they come in the restaurant business. 

Ask for Burrata with truffle oil. 
Get the salmon w cannelloni beans and arugula if they have it. Cooked to perfection in their 500° sauté method every single time. 

Otherwise, Bombolotti   

Get dessert!
author: Nick L.

description: this place makes me (and my husband) so happy, every time we go! it's lowkey, friendly, and very neighborhood-y. if you have been waiting awhile, they will acknowledge that, which is always nice. great for date night or taking out of town guests. I try not to order the spicy snapper every time, but I always fail.
author: Rachel T.

description:
Great Location, ultra-friendly staff, and an absolutely ideal location if you live in Pac Heights.  Thought this place was a laundromat the first 20 times I walked by, but as soon as I noticed the neon 'trattoria' sign, I knew I had to give this neighborhood Italian place a throw, and shit am I glad I did!

As mentioned in every other review, the comp bruschetta lives up to the hype, and often exceeds it.  Would still be a great deal even if one had to pay $7 for a bruschetta appetizer, but the fact that they bring a piece out to every diner on the house really sets the mood for a cozy, family-like atmosphere that so many Italian joints aspire to, but fall short of.

Great selection and variation on the menu without being overwhelming.  The fish special that I tried a few months ago was truly fabulous, and all the pasta dishes I have tasted have also been quite sensational.  A MUST if you live in Pac Heights!
author: Kyle S.

description:
Small from outside....your not even sure if it's a restaurant at first. Then the word Trattoria reveals itself. A MUST...get there early!!! If you don't live in the area, there is no parking to be found after 6am. Take the MUNI 22 Fillmore, and it's that easy.
 I was fortunate enough to live three houses down from this little gem in the city.   Our food was enjoyable with fast service (for a small business). A bit loud, maybe not the best for children but great for date night.

A plus, next door is Gino's...best wine selection and customer service!!!

***For those smokers (but only when you drink), always a small group of outlaws AKA smokers will unite outside once the bar gets busy...you will always make a friend=) ***
author: Quinn S.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for a romantic dinner while visiting San Francisco.  The bruschetta was delicious, as promised by the reviews.  The baked mushroom/prosciutto tortellini dish was a show-stopper, and we are still talking about it.  The other dishes were great, but couldn't hold a candle to that tortellini.  

Our service was sadly NOT good.  Our waiter essentially disregarded us from the moment we said we wouldn't be ordering any wine/drinks.  From that moment on, it was as if we were invisible.  He didn't tell us about the specials.  When we were putting our coats on and getting ready to leave, I turned around and saw the specials listed on the wall, I felt disappointed because I know I would have ordered some of them!  When we stopped him from handing us our check in order to tell him we wanted dessert, he looked shocked.  We felt very ignored and mistreated, which put a cloud over our experience.

Otherwise, the food was awesome.
author: Alexandra B.

description:
I quite like this place.  I've been twice now...including last night with my girlfriend.  She had the carbonara and I had the chicken w/ mushrooms/walnuts.  Both were quite solid.  I've had better carbonara and could not tell if the pasta was house made, but certainly would not recommend against it based on taste.  The chicken was quite tender and flavorful.  We also had the zucchini appetizer which we both agreed was unique and surprisingly tasty (we didn't know what to expect when we ordered it).

The service is always quite attentive as the owner typically roams about chatting with folks (seemingly many regulars which I take as a good sign).  

This place is very small and therefore is quite loud.  That is too be expected but be forewarned that that makes conversation a challenge.


That said, it's a place I'd certainly recommend and I'll certainly go back.
author: Michael B.

description: Loved the seafood stew! Service was great for our big party, and we fit despite being a small restaurant.
author: Katie M.

description: I just don't understand why in the world this place has only 3.5 stars!! It's absolutely delicious from the wine to the desserts. And excellent/fast service despite being busy. I had the barbera wine, which the host recommended we get the bottle and ended up being a great decision. Then they served us individually one big bruschetta, which was to die for. We all shared the buratta with eggplant and roasted peppers...delish! Then I ordered the spaghetti alla carbonara. Sooo freaken good. I tried every one else's food (we all ordered diff things) and liked everyone else's food as well. The tiramisu was very strong in rum flavor but I have no complaints ;) will DEF be coming back!!!
author: Jessica A.

description:
I have to agree with Ashley - no idea why people are complaining about the service - went there last night for the first time with a group, and the staff was completely accommodating..uh, albeit a little odd.  Couldn't pin the maitre d  down as to exact time our 9pm reservation was going to be honored... but, I chalk that up to the size of the place. (Think small.)

I've passed by this place a 1000 times and never knew it existed. Being at the corner of Jackson and Fillmore, the appropriately - yet unimaginatively - named trattoria is just one block north of the hustle and bustle of the rest of Fillmore street. (In fact, I can't think of anything else that is on that same block.)  A friend of mine (another Boston transplant who has become ridiculously good at picking restaurants lately) suggested it. With his track record, we all decided to give it a shot.

The wine selection was oddly tipped towards Spanish wines, but a great selection nonetheless. We received a nice, complementary bruschetta which was pretty excellent - especially since no one was expecting it. The seafood stew I had was top notch as well, with huge prawns and mussels swimming in a broth of tomato, olive oil and spices. The only part of the meal that amused me was the ordering of a "vegetarian" antipasta (which was excellent), but served unapologetically with a side of beautiful capicola. It was as though the chef could not bring himself to serve something without just a little selezione di carne. (Thereby insuring in my mind that the chef is, in fact, quite Italian.) 

I agreed with the decision, by the way - the capicola was excellent...
author: Rob D.

description:
Neighborhood vibe but international appeal. This trattoria is filled with regulars and you too can be in the know.

With reservations on a Friday night, the three of us were seated promptly with a smile. I was quick with a round of Prosecco and the waiter covered the specials. Wanting to graze on variety, we split an Insalada primavera: peas, fava beans, artichoke hearts, asparagus and percorino over arugala along with the Risoto Ubriaco with a red wine sauce. Light in the stomach but not on the flavor. We chose wisely. The Pesce Fra Diavolo: Red Snapper in a spicy tomato sauce and the Gnocchi Gratinatti with chicken and cheeses filled our table and our mouths. Mmmm mmmm good.

This hot spot is small, loud and bright filled with dates, families and friends enjoying great food and good service. Worth hopping a cab and crossing town for a great night on the town.
author: Mark F.

description:
So sad this place has fallen so far in the last 20 years. 
What is up with the calmari? Salted, rubbery and on a plate of lettuce?
Spaghetti carbonara was over presented with sauce; chicken sausage was...I don't know how to describe
Great staff but that doesn't cut it
Filthy bathroom and kitchen. No Excuse
Another lost restaurant in SF and the fact that so many Yelpers are impressed gives testimony to the knowledge of the newbies who have rolled into the Heights and Marina and consider themselves educated foodies. Again...more sadness
author: dottore b.

description: great food but the waiter was judgmental that I only ordered a beer instead of their expensive wine. It's not like I am some customer who splits a dish and orders water. Took 20 min for me to get my check, and the server was lucky to get 15%.
author: Blake K.

description:
Jackson Fillmore is a wonderful place,with wonderful people, who cook and serve a lot of wonderful things such as:

Calamari Fritti: best fried calamari I've had in years, maybe ever.
Carpaccio di Zuchini with almonds and pecorino 
Portobello Arrosto on a bed of arugula
Pecsce Fra Diavolo; fish in spicy hot tomato sauce
Veal chop: lots of garlic and herbs
Zabaglione Freddo with strawberries and crushed amaretto cookies. I thought about this zabaglione for days after I ate here.

Exquisite Montepulciano D'Abruzzo.

Thank you guys for a wonderful meal.
author: Loubna M.

description: I really like this restaurant and the food is very good.  My only complaint is that when I had dinner there on Wednesday night the tables were positioned so close together that the back of my chair was touching the back of another table's chair which was extremely uncomfortable.  I wish some thought would be given to adequate spacing between tables.
author: Diana K.

description: I have been eating here for over 20 years.  Food is great and I keep running into other people that say it's the best pasta in the area.  I agree!
author: David T.

description: Food was fresh and delicious. Felt a bit rushed, so tried to slow down the service. Blood orange salad-amazing. Linguine with clamp - very good. Portions were perfect. Highly recommend.
author: Patty G.

description:
Jackson Fillmore is a pretty good restaurant.  I haven't visited for several years until tonight, and was reminded of how tasty this place is.  There are so many good restaurants in this area, and in a radius of about 1 mile, that sometimes I forget places that are of 3-4+ star caliber for no real reason...except for being distracted by other options!

Overall, our meal was fine but not extraordinary. To start, the warm bruschetta (complimentary) is a great touch- and delicious.  The highlight of the meal for me was the arugula salad with slivers of salami- it was excellent.  The fried mozzarella appetizer was a large chunk of cheese overloaded with marinara sauce- and while it tasted OK, I probably will not order it again.  My wife ordered a gnocchi dish with smoked chicken in a cream sauce- she was not too excited about it, however I enjoyed it and will probably eat her leftovers for breakfast in about 10 minutes.  My dish was the Snapper 'a la diavolo'- which translates to snapper in a spicy as all hell tomato sauce. I recalled this dish from my previous visit several years ago and it's memory actually re-inspired our recent visit.  Strangely, I think I enjoyed it more the first time around- although it was Ok this time as well.  The snapper is completely coated with an extremely spicy marinara sauce, and actually looked on the surface like a larger version of the fried mozzarella dish!  The staff left a plastic pitcher of water on each table, which I thought seemed a bit cheesy at first, but I drank basically the whole thing to dilute the spice of the snapper.  Regardless, I enjoy this type of spicy punishment from time to time and I will order & enjoy this dish again on a future visit.

From my analysis of the menu- there seem to be many dishes served on the spicy side (Calabrese sauces, spicy sausage, etc), so if you enjoy spicy Italian food (and I do), this may be an excellent choice for you.  Spicy Italian food may have one dish or so on a typical menu, however there seemed to be many here.  This is not a place for a quiet, romantic date- the place is very small and compact, and the tables are very close together.  The restaurant was very busy around 7pm on a Thursday (good for them!) and the mix was mostly a crowd of 30 somethings and up.  Don't come here if you are looking for ornate 'picture perfect' plates- each portion was on the heavier side and seemed rather 'sloppy' in appearance but generous in quantity- essentially what I have come to expect from a 'home-style' Italian meal.

In summary, our meal for two appetizers, two entrees, and two glasses of wine was $95 (tip included).  The meal was quite tasty, and I will be back, but at this price point there is a lot of competition out there, and I think I would prefer to spend a comparable amount at A-16, Flour+Water, Ristorante Milano, Capannina, or Via Veneto.  However, when 'spicy' cravings come around again- Jackson Fillmore will come to mind.  I'll be back, but not too soon.
author: Andy S.

description:
