Well, he wasn't really listening either and once I asked if that was our table in the corner he rudely replied, "Oh no, that's for a party of 10" (which was ridiculous, they were cutting it close for 8 in this space), and then I had to ask, well did you get our reservation, I don't see another table for us...He arrogantly said, we can turn any table here into 8 and as I looked around, no one was even close to finishing.  This made me think that our party of 8 would be waiting for at least a half hour which is totally unacceptable given the confirmations that took place.  I waited near the hostess area to inquire further but he never made eye contact again and didn't return for at least 10 minutes, so I took our party down the street and had a wonderful meal elsewhere.  
I don't care if you have the best food in the world, if your staff is rude and arrogant; I will skip over your establishment every time.  I do not recommend.
author: Kate V.

description: This is my all time favorite Italian joint in the city.  So consistently delicious.  The servers - who I think must be part owners since they have been there since cavemen peed in snow - are sweet & sour, just the way I like em'!  You never know if the sommelier is going to pat you on the back with a brood smile etched across his face or roll his eyes in disgust at you.  Cultured Ma & Pop the only way SF can do.
author: Kelly O.

description: Really cute neighborhood restaurant and contrary to some of the other reviews I thought service was actually pretty good.  Only surprise was that corkage was $20, that seems kind of steep for a neighborhood joint and it's not like their wine service and glassware is spectacular.
author: Jen C.

description: Not a bad meal but nothing special, although I have to admit it felt quite authentic for a trattoria. The caponata salad was very good and the complimentary tomato bruschetta was the best thing about this meal. The pastas were OK. I had the tortellini all forno, it was tasty but too rich and my wife had the seafood pasta which was OK. Wines by the glass were tasty and fairly affortable. All in all, a good but not particularly memorable meal. I would try my luck elsewhere next time.
author: Chris D.

description: I have been here many times always sitting at the counter and enjoying lovely selections.... but the other week kinda ruined my desire to go back.  To begin with, we had reservations at 8:45, arrived at 8:45, saw our table for 6 sitting empty.  They sat a group of 4 at the table and then we waited until 9:30 to sit down.  Our group was famished.  The starter was wonderful - a pepper stuffed with tuna and olives.  I merely had a bite and contemplated ordering that as main.  But, I ordered the special salmon tagliatelle which tasted like eating crunchy old fish in an oily sauce.  - not at all fresh.   Only 2 stars because they messed up the reservations without acknowledging it and the main was way below par.
author: Ynez C.

description: Honestly I wasn't thrilled, it's pretty much standard fare, good, but nothing I'd go out of my way for.  On the plus side, the waitstaff was friendly, laid back and knowledgable about the menu.
author: Renae H.

description: Came here with a friend of mine whose family is very much the traditional , lively Italian family and he said this is the closest to authentic Italian food he's had in the city.  Great cozy spot...not ideal for big groups as our table took up half of the restaurant.
author: Tanger T.

description: The food was so good, I didn't care that the interior seemed dingy and the staff brusque.  Mine was a solid pasta dish with sun-dried tomatoes, olives, capers, shrimp and some other tasty vittles.  My friend had the roasted chicken and vegetables that was really generously sized and tasty, too.  And the complimentary bruschetta was so utterly delicious, I wished there'd been more.
author: M A N I K.

description: This place is really lively and popular with the neighborhood residents. I dont live in this area- but the food is worth a jaunt. They dont have big tables for large groups, but they will be happy to squeeze you in if you give them some time to work it out. The hostess was really nice even though they were very busy. I brought some visiting family here, and everybody left full and happy. HEY maybe I cant make dinner- but I can make one hell of a reservation! They loose one star because parking around there kinda sucks. Try the Clay St garage.
author: Melissa B.

description: My first impression was that you wouldn't have noticed it from the outside but inside, had a very LA feel- it's small, cozy, a clean look and at dinner, had dim lighting. I was excited to try the food to be someone disappointed- The dishes are rather pricey (average $15-$20) and the portions are small and the quality is alright...if I feel like I can make it, I shouldn't have to pay that much. A friend and I split the rigatoni with sausage and veggies which again was alright and I tried the gnocchi which was fared better than my pasta. Thank goodness, I went to at least one good restaurant during my short weekend in SF (Hog Island!)
author: Jenny L.

description: Reliable, low-key, cozy and delicious italian food. They do have checkered tablecloths, but in a nice authentic way in a great Pac Hts neighborhood. They don't take reservations, so be sure to get there early if you want to ensure you don't have to wait or come back. Better yet, if it's busy and it's just you and a friend, sit at the counter. You'll still get delicious italian food at a quite reasonable price. The italian wine selection isn't bad either.
author: Risa F.

description: This is definitely a nice neighborhood favorite- cozy without being cramped, as well as warm and friendly! The staff was helpful and efficient, and the service was pretty fast. The food was excellent and the portions are larger than you'd expect for the very reasonable pricing. The bruschetta is indeed delicious as are the pasta dishes...any of the gnocchi or ravioli plates are especially good. The meals are very filling though, so I haven't had a chance to have dessert here....yet!
author: Barbs J.

description: I can't say anything bad about the food or the service, both were great. Just wish they were open a little later. Everything we had was hot and fresh...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Love it, love it, love it!  I can't say enough good things about this place! It's a cute little neighborhood eatery with amazing food that won't break the bank. I've been here many times and will def. go back. The staff are all very friendly and the best part is that they bring out bruschetta for free!
author: Alison W.

description: Maybe I am biased because of all the great Italian restaurants I lived by in NYC, but Jackson Fillmore isn't worth all the hype.  Each time I go there I think it will get better, but it doesn't.   It's overpriced and not worth the long wait.  I would recommend going down Fillmore to the other more authentic Italian restaurants.
author: Jessica W.

description: had a good time here this weekend with my parents.  service was wonderful.  overall food was good but not my favorite pasta in the city.
author: a g.

description: Decent Italian food, I just didn't see what all the hype is about both here and in the Zagat guide as the food is not over-the-top phenomenal.  In my humble opinion there are better Italian restaurants in the City, but not necessarily in the Fillmore/Cow Hollow/Pac Heights area.
author: Katie P.

description: Good, simple food. The type of stuff that you eat and think about how easy and cheap it would be to make at home. The zuchinni carpaccio, however, is amazing in all of its simplicity. Somtimes its nice to get back to the basics and enjoy food without all of the pretention and fuss."
author: Nicole S.

description: I'm not big on complimentary starters, but the bruschetta was fantastic.  The artichoke app was unique and tasty.  The entire menu was seasonal, fresh, and authentic.  I loved all of the different flavors, not just pasta and garlic.  I thought the portions were huge, perfect for sharing.  My only complaint was the wine options.  There isn't much of a selection for fine wines by the glass.
author: Nicole G.

description: I felt it was a diner, then a sushi bar. it was a bit confusing yet interesting. the food was absolutely delicious . The Risotto was to die for. The service was good, Could have used a bit more of suggestions on the wine.  I will definitely  love to eat there again, maybe for lunch.
author: Joy I.

description:
we walked in on a wednesday evening around 7:30 pm, with the kiddies in tow (almost 9, and 4 1/2). the host said: "yay, kids! we love kids!". i'm not sure how much sarcasm i should have read in his voice, but he promptly brought a little glass full of colored pencils and some old menus, so he can't have been hating on us all that much. my son took it at face value and said: "they like kids, here!". 

our waiter, with his very entertainingly styled whiskers, showed up promptly with the specials board--a little slate that details the night's offerings, gave us a little time to discuss, and came back soon after to take our order. an excellent barbera d'alba and complimentary bruschetta appeared swiftly.

the antipasto misto was very much appreciated by all. my son tried a few different things and enjoyed them very much, thereby expanding his nascent culinary culture. my daughter ate everything in sight as usual. the pasta and secondi were just as appreciated. the salmon, served with arugula and cold bean salad, was expertly cooked and deemed excellent. the special ravioli calabrese, a large pocket of fine pasta filled with a light mixture of cheese and herbs, topped with slices of calabrese sausage and a brothy tomato sauce, was just this side of perfection. we had ordered a serving of spaghetti marinara for the children and it came pre-split in two bowls without our even asking. we topped the meal with tiramisu and biscotti con vin santo, and went home happy--for what feels like an eminently reasonnable price.

this wasn't our first visit, of course--after all, we've lived in the west of the city since 1996 (!), but it had been a while, and the first time with kids. it felt special and as good as it ever was.
author: Sonia M.

description: A fun eveniong tonight with 7 of us enjoying the food and atmosphere.  Strongly reccomend the sausage and potatoes and the desert menu is wonderful.  Fun waitress and good service.
author: Alan L.

description: The service was great and they were very nice to our baby BUT no high chairs (just booster seats) and the food was soooo fat laden to the point where I could only take a few bites of the Gnocci. The roasted chicken in it tasted like deli cut meat and the cheese was so over whelming that I couldn't eat my meal. For $15.50 I expected a meal with substance not drenched in fat. Really disappointing food considering the high prices. We tried a few other dishes and they were ok but not worth returning to!
author: Emilia D.

description: Food for the undiscerning pallet...don't expect 'authentic Italian'. It's hard to comprehend how Italian food, so easy to get right, can be presented and cooked so poorly. The restaurant also lacks 'warm-heartedness' and passion, a traditional ingredient of the better Italian trattorias. They were kind enough to reimburse one of our mains.
author: Vp G.

description: An old favorite but I haven't been here in years.  Had a great meal here tonight, included the complimentary bruscetta, so awesome, mozerella nmisto, again so awesome, and a great gnocci, one of the best I've had.  The place comes off a bit "Soup Nazi" at the beginning due to their no resverations policy, but lightens up as the meal goes on.
author: e w.

description: since i live near here, i really wish i loved this place. unfortunately, little is homemade here. a forgettable to poor experience...
author: arielle r.

description:
Love Jackson Fillmore, great value and the wine list is killer!!! Lots of interesting wines at inexpensive prices. I love starting out with the bruscetta and the Chicken Contadina is always a favorite!
Recently I noticed (Jack-owner) back in the saddle cooking behind the line, the food has been better then ever! Lots of new dishes, if you haven't been there in a while, its worth heading back.
author: Michael H.

description:
As someone who lives in the area I have been to this place more than a few times and I have never been disappointed with the quality of the food.

If you are looking for an authentic Italian restaurant, look no further.  However, the authenticity does not stop at the food, as in Italy the service leaves much to be desired.  The place is usually very busy, so get a reservation and if you walk-in do NOT believe the owner when he tells you it will be 5-10 minutes.  It will more likely be 30-45 minutes and that is in part due to the absurdly slow service.  In addition, the plates are quite small, which I consider part of the authenticity, but nevertheless I have often found myself hungry upon leaving.

But all-in-all I good place for Italian and a local favorite.
author: Vincent K.

description:
This was the first time in my adult life I've experienced discrimination based on my age in a restaurant.  Myself and two of my other 22 year old friends went in on a Saturday night without reservations, around 6:45.  The place was full, and there was a couple ahead of us waiting to be seated.  The man at the front assured us it wouldn't be too long, three seats at the bar should open up very quickly,  My fried ordered a glass of wine while we waited and myself and other friend opted not to (it had already been a long Friday of drinking for me).

Maybe that was our mistake.  From that point forward, the couple ahead of us was seated, followed by another two people who waltzed in without reservations ("They're regulars- the other people should be getting dessert and finishing it soon"), followed by the two people behind us who became three last minute and were seated at a table recently vacated (they didn't seem to have any sort of reservations), followed by a party of four who I am positive did not have reservations.  They were graciously led to a table, while my friends and I were led to the bar seating (which also held four).  Everyone seated before us was in their 30s or older.  Got some more abrupt service from the waiter, nothing fantastic or friendly, just functional.  At one point he brought over a salad that we hadn't ordered, and I had half a mind to eat it since the billing system let me know that he hadn't written it down for us.  But somehow I figured it would come back at some sort of triple charge on our bill, so I gave it back to him.

Food was fine- I had the spaghetti alla carbonara, and the free bruschetta was good.  They tried to charge my friend for the $12 glass of wine instead of the $9 one she ordered.  I think I'm going to leave this place for the affluent middle agers, since clearly I wasn't too welcome.
author: Casey M.

description:
hmmm...perhaps i am biased because i grew up half-italian, but i can't give a glowing review.  but it was still decent.
the highlights:
1) dessert.  damn.
2) pasta was good.  had the spaghetti and "large pasta tubes" aka rigatoni.  "large pasta tubes" = $17 a dish.  rigatoni = $8 a dish.  Note to self...if you ever open a restaurant, call your rigatoni "large pasta tubes" and charge double.
3) easier than cooking
4) the piece of bruschetta rocks.
the lowlights:
1) ambience was so-so
2) guessing which person was your wait(e)r(ess).  4 different people helped us, but i like personal service.
author: Joe L.

description: This is one of my "go to" restaurants.  The food is great (try the Tortellini al Forno or the Spaghetti Carbonara) and the ambiance is very low key.  Perfect for an easy evening out when you want a good bite but don't really feel like getting dressed up.  Be warned that it can be very crowded at times and is also on the noisy side.
author: Ken E.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE!!!! I REPEAT, DO NOT GO HERE!

The food is ok at best! the service is lousy and rude!  They even charged us an extra 10 bucks, but because we were with a group, we didn't make want to make a scene.  We had gone here a month ago, the food was ok  service was a bit rude but heard so many good reviews from others that we thought, let's give it another try.  That was a HUGE MISTAKE.  We should've trusted our instincts.  We had a party of 6, and were seated initially at a 6 person table and then 15 mins later got moved to the back of a table to fit 3 comfortably, but we had 6 people.  I really think we got moved  because we were all people of COLOR.  Some folks had dietary restrictions and the waiter would not willingly comfirm the ingredients.  A simple question as, does this contain any non-veg ingredient should have a simple yes/no answer or a 'let me check' response.  But this waiter was not willing to go the extra simple step to double-check.

All in all, a horrible experience that was unfortunately shared by all of us!
author: Ro R.

description: Awful service can't make up for good food. The hostess was not nice and the waiter served the food as if he were doing us a favor.  Don't think I'll be going back here again.
author: Geraldine S.

description: This is an interesting restaurant because it is a mixed bag. It is a fun, cozy neighborhood restaurant with good Italian food. The people that run the place are really a mess as things go...If they know you, e.g. you're a regular as many patrons are, you get definite priority, regardless of fairness/how long you've waited, what they have promised you. They will tell you "5 minutes" to be seated and right in front of you, they will walk regulars without reservations right over to the table they have promised you. On a Sundy night, they have a seating and a half, by 8:45, they are playing Spanish salsa music so loud, they are clearly trying to clear out the remaining patrons. It's little league, really. The service is crap, the food is pretty good. This restaurant is an institution that needs a manager who actually knows what she's doing.
author: Out And About I.

description: WOW!!! If you love personal service with great food, this is the place! The staff treats you like family and Jack the owner, is a great guy! The food is awesome.Service is outstanding!! Italian food served with love.
author: Charlie W.

description: This place fits the bill as a homey, neighborhood spot.  The food is great, the price is right, and the staff couldn't be friendlier.  Highly recommended for a casual chat with friends in Pac Heights.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: DEVINE!  This was some of the best Italian food I've ever eaten.  I had the Insalata Romana followed by the Pollo alla Noci.  Just devine!  Service was great...and the place was crowded, so RESERVE in advance.
author: Aileen K.

description: i really enjoyed JF Trattoria! our server was super patient as our group was a little indecisive, giving great recommendations and descriptions then allowing us more time to look over the menu. i ordered one of their specials following his recommendation, the chicken/pork meet balls with potato and garbanzo beans... SO good, i wish it was always on the menu! it was hot, very tasty and more food then i could ever eat in one sitting. everyone at our table ordered a diff dish and almost every dish was a big hit. the gnocchi had the highest rave at our table. i will be returning no question.
author: Barbara C.

description: Great food, good service, good wine, good location.  Make sure to order off the specials board!
author: Mary B.

description:
Awful.  One star, only because I can't  see how to give zero stars.

Saturday, 4 or 5pm well before the rush.  Place is nearly deserted.  We had wanted to try this place for a long time, and now was our chance!  Walked in, got directed to a two top directly in the walkway from the door into the dining room.  We said, "Thanks, we will sit at the bar (practically deserted).  Sat down, and got told, "no you have to sit at the end of the bar".

We were friendly when we walked in, and got nothing but attitude from the staff, which is somewhat more OK if they are getting hammered by customers on a busy night.  This was not even close to busy.

The food is probably good in this place, judging by other reviews.  But there is no hospitality in this place.  We left after being told to take different seats at the bar.  Had a really nice dinner at another restaurant on Fillmore.  It's called Chouquet's and I recommend it to everyone.

Wake up Jackson Fillmore:  there are plenty of places on Fillmore that have good food *and* hospitality.  Before long they will take your customers.
author: Mike B.

description: A good reliable neighborhood trattoria.  The food quality has gone down a bit over the years but it remains a reasonable choice with good food that isn't too too expensive.  They give everyone free brushetta to start off with which is a nice tasty treat.  The afogoda (sp?) which is espresso over ice cream for dessert is well worth the trip in itself.
author: michael l.

description:
I had my first date with my husband was at this wonderful Italian place 7 years ago.  We were waiting what they said would be the 15 minutes until a table would free up, when the hostess came up to us to tell us that the folks at the table they thought would be freed up for us just pulled out a stack of pictures...it may be a while, she said.  Can i get you a complimentary glass of wine?  um, yeah.  The wine was delicious, the food that came not too much later was amazing.  We remember the Spaghetti Carboara - so rich and perfectly al dente. 
We finally made it back there and could not figure out what took us so long.  The host was just as generous, this time taking down my cell number to call when the table was ready while we took a walk in our old neighborhood.  The food again was fabulous.  Delicious complimentary bruscetta to start (they must scrape garlic onto the toasted bread before topping it with a yummy fresh tomato, basil, olive oil mixture).  We followed it with a smoky asparagus and pancetta salad - so good.  Then back to the carbonara for him and a lightly fried chicken breast, so beautifully cooked, topped with gorgonzola and portabello mushrooms for me. We shared and the dishes complimented each other perfectly.  We were a bit under-dressed (it was a spur of the moment thing) but we were treated very well by the staff despite this.  
My only regret is that we couldn't order more!!  There were about a dozen other things on the menu that I wish I could have ordered too.  It was bustling but romantic, expensive but worth it. We love this place!!!
author: Sarah G.

description: terrible service here and its not the best italian. skip it
author: Torres F.

description: My mom loves this place, but I must admit that I wasn't completely wowed. For being located on Fillmore, I think I expected more from both the ambiance and decor, as well as its popularity. The restaurant was half full on a Friday night!  In terms of the food, the bombolotti and the red snapper were excellent and definitely worth returning for. The seafood linguini was pretty standard, but not memorable. I definitely did not enjoy any of their salads. I'm the type of person that orders a salad at dinner to be health conscious, but these were not even passable. The mixed green salad was made with romaine, slathered in an extremely creamy dressing, and was scattered with carrots, tomatoes, cucumber, and cauliflower. The radicchio salad didn't have enough flavors to balance its bitterness. I think that I can overlook all of that though because the tiramisu was one of the best I've ever tasted. I'll definitely come back, if only to try some of the other dishes they have to offer, excluding leafy greens, and have another slice of that divine dessert.
author: Lauren Y.

description: Delicious! I rarely write reviews, but had to comment on this great local Italian joint. The place is small and I would call for a reservation if you'd like a table- especially if you have a party of 4 or more. I got the Penne which had to have been the best pasta dish I've had- a very light cream sauce with vegetables. Mmmm! We tried the artichoke app per all the yelp reviews- but it wasn't my favorite. Try the Barabara red wine by the class- YUM!
author: Bryn K.

description: This place is amazing. I ordered the eggplant parm and it was the best eggplant parm i have ever had. there is so much hype around this restaraunt and i decided after i finally went there, it is well deserved. The ambiance leaves a little something to be desired and the waiting staff isn't the most attentive, but i guess that just makes it more authentic.
author: libby s.

description: Best Italian that we've tried in the city...laid back atmosphere, great food, great service.  What more do you need?
author: Willy C.

description: I love Jackson Fillmore!  Always great food that I have come to expect!  The only thing you have to be weary of is the staff.  They are not there to make you feel good or engage in endless banter.  They are not unfriendly, but I wouldnt consider them warm.  They definitely could improve their people skills, but the food is what keeps me coming back!  The tortellini is what I always order and I have a hard time switching to anything else because it's that amazing!  And the brushetta is a wonderful beginning!
author: Emily T.

description:
ehhh... Moderatly priced, mediocre food, so-so ambiance.  

There's a ton of italian restaurants on Fillmore and this one is not in the top 5.  Go try someplace else.  The only reason I will ever come back is because it's close to my house and it's relatively inexpensive.  But...really, I probably won't be back.
author: Susie G.

description: The bruschetta and eggplant parmisan are out of this world. The place can be noisy and cramped, but great for a neighborhood atmosphere.
author: K D.

description: ohh how i miss this place, i had a chicken dish that was amazing, the bruschetta is a big bonus, i was not expecting brushetta, the pastas are WOW, and the zabaglione..........dio mio thats good.
author: Richard C.

description:
love this place. the wait can be long sometimes, but i totally think it's worth it. it's a real neighborhood restaurant. the complimentary bruschetta is delicious and all the pastas are divine. 
don't be against sitting at the bar. i think the service is faster there. :)
author: April W.

description: Really great Italian food at a really great price in a neighborhood where almost everything is over priced. Very relaxed and casual atmosphere. I eat here 2 or 3 times a month and I have never had a bad meal or a bad time.
author: Gary G.

description: good Italian food and a pretty casual vibe. great risotto. but can get pretty crowded on the weekends.
author: Mike K.

description: Really - not so good. Yes it was nice to get 1 piece of bruschetta comped, but, for a basic plate of pasta with a few pieces of asparagus, a few fava beans and 1 artichoke leaf for $16 - come on. I am a SF foodie and can get better at so many places,,,,I guess from the other reviews being a regular would've helped, particularly with the somewhat curse greeting at the door - oh well.
author: Maggie S.

description: Best neighborhood Italian place in Pac Heights, except it gets increasingly crowded as the week progresses.  Good wine selection and great pasta.
author: Dave D.

description: Although I had heard raves from some coworkers, I wasn't thrilled with this place.  First off, I didn't know that we needed reservations for parties of 3 or more.  Which is fine.  Next time I'll know.  But the manager of the place was pretty rude to us.  Listen, it's all in how you tell people things. So we got that out of the way and sat at the counter.  The complimentary bruschetta is a nice touch.  My friend ordered pasta, but since she is vegetarian she requested it be with marinara instead of meat sauce.  They did not screw this up, until we got the check and not only did they not reduce the price, but they added a dollar or two to the original item on the menu?! When we asked the manager he shrugged it off and said because it was a "special order" they charged that much.  Finally after talking it over and explaining that it didn't make any sense, he docked the extra dollar he charged and lowered the price by another dollar.  Thanks.  It would be a decent place if the service weren't so bad. (such a pity since I live just yards away)
author: Rosie S.

description: Utterly mediocre.  I had a chicken dish that consisted of tiny pieces of chicken on the bone in a perfectly forgettable sauce.  Spent most of the time trying to pick the bits of meat from the bone.  No sides by the way.  With a glass of wine and tip, I paid something like $30.  Really?  You can do better down the street or at home.
author: Keith J.

description: Yum.  Good service.  This place gets crowded early so I'd advise a reservation.  Cheesy deliciousness (friend cheese app) and sweet italian sodas.
author: Jessie H.

description: came here once after a long sunday funday and just wanted some tasty italian food with a glass of wine with 2 friends, and I got exactly that. the menu is pretty good, the food tasted quite good, can't say service blew me away, but that was ok as we were tired. great way to end a weekend, and we were happy
author: Rich B.

description: Yeah, the service is a bit 'European', but the food could have been made in Italy, which says a lot.  Far better to go here than waste your time at Via Venetto down the street.
author: Larry M.

description: We love this place. If you show up, and you are a regular, they will find a table for you. I have never been disappointed by the food or the service. Try the orrechiete (sp?) and the zucchini salad!
author: Nora Q.

description: A perfect neighborhood place. Atmosphere is casual. The food speaks for itself. The gnocchi were some of the best I've ever had outside Italy. Yummie! My friend ordered the chicken, and it was perfectly cooked and juicy. We also shared the artichoke salad. Refreshing. Wish they had more wines by the glass selection. I'm not much of a drinker so I wouldn't buy a whole bottle. I've walked by this place for years and it has always been busy. Now I know why. I can't wait to go again.
author: Lisa J.

description: I had heard a great deal about this spot and I walk by it regularly on my way home for work, so I was eager to try this traditional Italian restaurant. People consistently remarked on the charm of the ambience, but also warned against the hostile service; ironically I heard little about the food. When I arrived for my 7:30 reservation they indicated unapologetically that they would seat my group in 10-15 minutes. When we were seated, the servers made utterly clear their desire to turn our table. When we ordered a second bottle of wine I think the waiter actually sighed in annoyance. My Chicken Sicilian was served in a more family style manner then I anticipated, i.e., no sides or garnishes. The flavor was okay, a bit mild and nothing to write home about. Ultimately, while it is such a cute spot, and a true neighborhood find, I doubt I will rush back.
author: Erin S.

description: ok food.service is pretty good. awesome dessert.
author: aj s.

description:
been going here for over a decade. the food is good.  the people are like family.  it's my kitchen away from home.   so despite whatever minor issues that come and go, over time, it's still the same sweet place.  
their menu has changed so they don't carry my two favorite dishes anymore though they keep making them for me when i go so i haven't tried the new dishes. the elephant ears are really good.  their zucchini carpaccio is amazing and they have the best zabaglione in town.
author: Yelper S.

description: Overall, I was impressed with great tasting food using simple recipes. A couple friends and I shared the risotto, seafood medley and half-chicken. My favorite was the chicken with semi-crisp pancetta in a lemon caper sauce. Great combination of savory with a hint of tanginess. The seafood medley (clams, mussels, shrimp and fish) in a tomato base was a little salty for my taste. I was disappointed when I ordered a cab/merlot blend and they poured it in a small burgundy glass...I'm no wine expert, but it probably would've breathed better in a proper red wine glass. We capped off the meal with a zabaliogne freddo - a great treat since not many places serve this traditional Italian dessert. On the negative side, service was too relaxed and inattentive, and there were a few gnats cruising around our table.
author: James Y.

description: OVERRATED!  I really wanted to like this place since so many people talk so highly about it.  I honestly believe Jackson Fillmore is too hyped up.  I tried this place 2x and got sick both times.  Tip:  stick to the basic pasta dishes (which aren't really that great) and don't order seafood or meat...you'll get sick.  Cute location, cute setting, conveniently located by my place...but there are too many other great places in the neighborhood that have more to offer.  Don't waste your time!
author: Maria S.

description: THE BEST food, best service, extremely tasty, delicious food, great service, they are so friendly always smile and say hello. Our favorite.
author: Lisa G.

description:
Food is okay but the service was awful!  When we asked politely to switch tables (we were seated next to the front door and  one of our chairs was uncomfortably close to the constant opening of it), the waiter rolled his eyes, looked over to the host and said, "These people don't like where they're seated.".   Incredibly rude!  After we moved tables, the service went downhill.  The waiter appeared completely put out, he never smiled, and he was comically abrupt.  There's nothing I hate more than bad customer service.  
What can I say about the food?  I had the risotto and it was nice--good flavors.  My husband had the chicken which was tender and tasty.  The spaghetti was just okay. Unfortunately, I am one of those people who won't go back to a restaurant if I experienced distasteful service (and believe me, I'm not picky about where or what I eat, but a simple smile goes a long way in the ambiance department).  If you're just into the food, it's worth a try.  But if you want to enjoy the night without some rude waiter around, then definitely do not go the the Jackson Fillmore.  BAD, BAD, BAD SERVICE!!!!!
author: Luana L.

description: have been eating here since i was a kid.  they changed the menu and i think it's maybe beginning to suck.  they undercooked my boyfriend's fish to the point it was COLD inside.  their wine pours looked like shots.  made me sad.  i guess i am not good with change.  but mostly when the change is "this used to be awesome, homey, had good ravioli, and now it's kind of eh." the complimentary bruschetta is still rocking, though.
author: K H.

description: have been coming here with my family since i was nine. i love it just as much now as i did when i was younger. the bruscetta is the most perfect mixture of olive oil, fresh basil, tomatos, salt, and garlic. they bring it out right away. it is small, loud, and bustling, and blaring loud rock music, in the tradition of italian trattorias. the menu is simple, northern and southern italian highlights. go for the handwritten specials though, they shine and shine. the desserts are all wonderful, but the best is the zabaglione freddo, a frothy custard of eggs, marsala wine, cream and sugar. added are amaretto cookies on the bottom. it is out of this world, my sister-in-law swears by it and couldn't find its match, even in italy!!!
author: Lesley S.

description: worst dinner experience i have ever had.  waited for a half an hour for a table, and decided to sit at the open bar to rest our feet.  so hungry we looked at a menu - and decided to order an appetizer.  the owner would not allow us to order food until we had our table.  i thought this was ridiculous!!!  he was so rude and inhospitable.  we could have walked out but we were too hungry.  when we finally sat and had our meal, we were given the bill without even being offered dessert / coffee.  i will never come here again.
author: c s.
